<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="165"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We may underestimate how many cycles we need to wait, but this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="166"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// isn&#39;t a big deal. Our return value is just how many cycles until</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="167"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// this function gets run again. So as long as we don&#39;t overestimate</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="168"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the wait time, we&#39;ll still end up stalling at this instruction</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="169"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// for the correct number of cycles.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="170"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00188" /><CodeLine lineNumber="188"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Should probably be checking for nullptr</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00189" /><CodeLine lineNumber="189"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// here, but I&#39;m not sure how I should handle the case</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00201" /><CodeLine lineNumber="201"><span class="doxyHighlight">                           &lt;&lt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;ignored. So the wait may not be accurate.\\n&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00231" /><CodeLine lineNumber="231"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">void</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> AMDGPUCustomBehaviour::generateWaitCntInfo() &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00232" /><CodeLine lineNumber="232"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The core logic from this function is taken from</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00233" /><CodeLine lineNumber="233"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// SIInsertWaitcnts::updateEventWaitcntAfter() In that pass, the instructions</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00234" /><CodeLine lineNumber="234"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// that are being looked at are in the MachineInstr format, whereas we have</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// access to the MCInst format. The side effects of this are that we can&#39;t use</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the mayAccessVMEMThroughFlat(Inst) or mayAccessLDSThroughFlat(Inst)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// functions. Therefore, we conservatively assume that these functions will</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00238" /><CodeLine lineNumber="238"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// return true. This may cause a few instructions to be incorrectly tagged</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// with an extra CNT. However, these are instructions that do interact with at</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// least one CNT so giving them an extra CNT shouldn&#39;t cause issues in most</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00241" /><CodeLine lineNumber="241"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// scenarios.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00242" /><CodeLine lineNumber="242"><span class="doxyHighlight">  AMDGPU::IsaVersion <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/lib/support/blake3/blake3-impl-h/#a78823051d1dad34b9b3d8120112e674d">IV</a> = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/amdgpu/#a4c450943f424116a9b6b9a3db451af6c">AMDGPU::getIsaVersion</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mca/custombehaviour/#a8f327d1084786084e10242b9868cdf74">STI</a>.getCPU());</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="278"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// (IV.Major &lt; 7) is meant to represent</span></CodeLine>
